intro: Mesembryanthemum calycinum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick leaves that store water and reduce transpiration. It typically blooms in spring and summer, producing clusters of small, bright yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Mesembryanthemum calycinum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant appearance and drought tolerance.
